thread.title: Snow brings school closures, transit delays across Metro Vancouver, Fraser Valley
thread.title_full: Snow brings school closures, transit delays across Metro Vancouver, Fraser Valley

author: cbc
title: Snow brings school closures, transit delays across Metro Vancouver, Fraser Valley
text:
A dusting of fresh snow Sunday night has the Monday morning commute off to a slippery start in the greater Vancouver area, with many school districts cancelling classes altogether.
A number of bus routes have been detoured and there are delays due to the road conditions.
Some routes that usually run larger articulated buses are running smaller buses to prevent problems, including the 49, the 95 and the 99 B-line.
Environment Canada has issued a snowfall warning for the South Coast, calling for between 10 and 15 fresh centimetres of snow by Tuesday morning, though it expects significant regional variation.
Some parts of the region, including the Fraser Valley, have seen as much as 60 centimetres of snow since Friday.
List of school closures A number of schools on both the mainland and Vancouver Island have announced closures.
Surrey, Chilliwack, Langley, Abbotsford, Hope, Mission, Maple Ridge-Pitt Meadows and Cowichan Valley districts have all cancelled Monday classes.
The University of the Fraser Valley also cancelled all classes for Monday.
Other schools closed Monday include:
Langley Montessori School Burnaby Montessori School St. Thomas Moore Collegiate Fraser Valley Elementary The King's School
